alert.note: Alert for Kings; New York (Manhattan); Queens (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 11:33AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following counties, Kings (Brooklyn), New York (Manhattan) and Queens. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1131 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.0 inch are expected over the area. This rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jamaica, Flatbush, Flushing, Crown Heights, Laguardia Airport, Kennedy Airport, Jackson Heights, Forest Hills, Canarsie, Bay Ridge, Astoria, Lower East Side, Whitestone, Howard Beach, Ozone Park, Brooklyn Heights, Long Island City, Park Slope, Bensonhurst and Woodside. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
